result.execSummary:
The defendant Jalen J. Spaay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.

AODA and follow through.

DNA sample.

No objection to Interstate Compact Probation Transfer to Michigan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

VRCW.
Date & Time set Hearing re: Failutre to meet with DOC. 

State has met with DOC Agent re: PSI. 
Attorney Mayo recites status of matters; 
Defendant states that he has been seeking out new counsel. 
Attorney Roley makes statement. Defendant explains reasonsing for PSI miscommunication. 
K.S. shows a notice of hearing to the Court.  Parties were conflicted re: possible new charge.
Court addresses defendant. DOC Agent states that PSI can be completed by sentencing date. 
Attorney Roley is requesting to withdrawal.  Defendant makes statement, and will be hiring Attorney Dave Casey. 
Court is keeping sentencing date 7/6. Court allows Attorney Roley to withdraw from all cases. 
Defendant confirms phone number: 715-348-2344 with voicemail. 
Court directs defendant to contact Probation and Parole. 
PSI due by 6/27.

AMENDED: $5000 Signature bond with the first $500 in cash:  No contact with victim(s): P.J.S. or T.J.S.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. No objection to Defendant residing outside of WI.
